News.Title: DCX Systems' Material Subsidiary Raneal Advanced Systems Faces Statutory Auditor Resignation
News.Summary: Rajagopala and Co resigned as statutory auditors of DCX Systems' material subsidiary Raneal Advanced Systems Private Limited effective May 12, 2025, citing internal realignment of audit assignments within the group to maintain independence and avoid overlapping professional engagements. DCX Systems disclosed this resignation with a delay, acknowledging an inadvertent oversight in not submitting the intimation to stock exchanges within the prescribed timeline.

News.Title: DCX Systems Secures Purchase Orders Worth INR 16.45 Crores for Cable and Wire Harness Manufacturing
News.Summary: DCX Systems Limited received purchase orders worth INR 16.45 crores from international customers for manufacturing and supplying cable and wire harness assemblies. The company's wholly owned subsidiary Raneal Advanced Systems also secured orders worth INR 6.44 crores for printed circuit board assemblies from international customers.

News.Title: DCX Systems Outlines Multi-Year Growth Strategy Through Defence Exports and Manufacturing Expansion
News.Summary: DCX Systems has outlined a multi-year growth strategy focused on defence exports and electronics manufacturing, supported by a robust order book from offset programs. The company is expanding its aerospace and cable assembly capabilities while targeting higher margins through backward integration and strategic partnerships with global OEMs.

News.Title: DCX Systems Submits Monitoring Agency Reports for IPO and QIP Proceeds Utilization
News.Summary: DCX Systems Limited submitted monitoring agency reports from CARE Ratings for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, covering utilization of proceeds from its Rs. 400 crore IPO and Rs. 500 crore QIP. For the IPO, the company has fully utilized Rs. 289.8 crore across debt repayment (Rs. 110 crore), working capital (Rs. 160 crore), and subsidiary investment (Rs. 19.8 crore). The remaining Rs. 62.49 crore earmarked for general corporate purposes remains unutilized, with the company obtaining board approval to reallocate Rs. 65.99 crore towards working capital and capital expenditures. For the QIP, Rs. 209.72 crore has been utilized for subsidiary investment in NIART Systems, while Rs. 276.93 crore remains unutilized. The company signed a joint venture agreement with ELTAS Systems Limited for Rs. 200 crore investment, though establishment is pending regulatory approvals. Unutilized funds from both offerings are deployed in fixed deposits earning 6.65% to 7.75% returns.

News.Title: DCX Systems Reports 29% Decline in Q2 Net Profit to 72 Million Rupees
News.Summary: DCX Systems reported a net profit of 72 million rupees for Q2, down from 102 million rupees in the same quarter last year, representing a 29% year-over-year decline. The company's revenue for the quarter was 1.9 billion rupees compared to 1.95 billion rupees in the previous year, showing a marginal decrease of 2.6%.

News.Title: DCX Systems Secures Purchase Orders Worth INR 49.89 Crores
News.Summary: DCX Systems has received purchase orders valued at approximately INR 49.89 crores. The orders represent new business for the company.

News.Title: DCX Systems Signs MOU with Tamil Nadu Government for Defense Manufacturing Facility in Hosur
News.Summary: DCX Systems Limited signed a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding with the Government of Tamil Nadu at the 'T N Rising Investment Conclave' held on September 11, 2025 in Hosur. The MOU establishes a manufacturing facility for a joint venture company in Hosur, Tamil Nadu, focusing on producing Airborne Maritime Radar Systems, Fire Control Radar Systems, and other Radar Systems for Airborne and Land applications under 'Make in India' projects. This follows DCX Systems' prior joint venture agreement with ELTA Systems Ltd, Israel dated April 21, 2025. The Tamil Nadu government's nodal agency 'Guidance' will provide infrastructural support and regulatory facilitation to help obtain necessary permissions, registrations, approvals, and incentives. The facility will be located in one of India's Defence Industrial Corridors under the Tamil Nadu Industrial Policy 2021 and Tamil Nadu Aerospace and Defence Industrial Policy 2022.

News.Title: DCX India Announces CFO Resignation and New Director Appointment
News.Summary: DCX India announced significant leadership changes during its board meeting on August 18, 2025. Mr. Diwakaraiah N J resigned from his dual roles as Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer, with his resignation taking effect on August 31, 2025. He had submitted his resignation letter on July 31, 2025. The company will appoint a new CFO in due course. Simultaneously, the board approved the appointment of Mr. Gopinath Vedaprakash as Additional Whole-Time Director, effective September 1, 2025, subject to shareholder approval. Mr. Vedaprakash brings 37 years of experience in electronics industries serving Defence, Aerospace, Space, Industrial and Transportation sectors. He previously worked at Tata Advanced Systems Limited for over 5 years and had a 23-year tenure at Centum Electronics in various leadership positions. The appointment was recommended by the Nomination & Remuneration Committee and requires shareholder approval.

News.Title: DCX Systems Reports Strong Q1 Performance with Revenue Jump to 2.2B Rupees

News.Title: DCX Systems Announces Agreement with BEL and Joint Venture with ELTA Systems
News.Summary: DCX Systems has entered into an agreement with Bharat Electronics (BEL) to supply electronic modules. Under this agreement, DCX Systems will receive a back-to-back order if BEL secures a contract. Additionally, DCX Systems is forming a joint venture with ELTA Systems Israel, which is expected to require Rs 150-200 crore in capital expenditure. The company aims to finalize and begin operations for this joint venture within 11 months.

News.Title: DCX Systems Outlines Growth Plans and Order Book Expectations
News.Summary: DCX Systems has provided updates on its business outlook during a conference call. The company expects to deliver its current order book over the next 2 years, targeting execution of orders worth Rs 500 crore in this period. DCX aims to transition into a product company, anticipating higher margins of 30-40% in the aerospace and defense industry. The company projects receiving orders for 1,750 units in other countries over the next 3 years. Additionally, DCX Systems expects to deploy its product on 5,000 to 6,000 locomotives in India over the next 5 years.

News.Title: DCX Systems Ltd: Q4 Earnings Miss Triggers 7% Stock Drop

News.Title: DCX Systems Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: DCX Systems has released its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA for Q4 was 42 million rupees, down from 302 million rupees year-over-year. The EBITDA margin decreased to 0.85% from 4.05% in the same period last year. Net profit for Q4 was 93 million rupees, compared to 259 million rupees year-over-year and 117 million rupees quarter-over-quarter. Revenue for Q4 stood at 4.95 billion rupees, down from 7.46 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.
